properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 6 at 5:38PM ChST until February 7 at 10:00AM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
properties.description:
...BRIEF INCREASE IN NORTH SWELL TO CAUSE HAZARDOUS SURF AT TINIAN
AND SAIPAN TONIGHT...

.TANAPAG BUOY AND ALTIMETRY DATA SHOW BUILDING SEAS...MAINLY FROM A
INCREASING NORTH SWELL GENERATED FROM A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT
MOVED OFF OF JAPAN EARLIER THIS WEEK. THIS PULSE IN NORTH SWELL IS
EXPECTED TO BE TEMPORARY SUCH THAT SURF ALONG NORTH SHORES WILL BEGIN
TO FALL FRIDAY.

* ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS...HAZARDOUS SURF OF 7 TO 10 FEET WILL
CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY MORNING. SURF WILL SLOWLY SUBSIDE
THROUGH THE MORNING AND SHOULD FALL BELOW HAZARDOUS LEVELS OF 9
FEET AROUND MIDDAY. THE HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS IS EXPECTED TO
ALSO FALL TO MODERATE AROUND MIDDAY.

* ALONG EAST FACING REEFS...SURF HAS FALLEN TO BETWEEN 6 AND 8
FEET. AS A RESULT...THE HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS HAS DROPPED TO
MODERATE.
properties.instruction:
DO NOT VENTURE NEAR REEF LINES ALONG NORTH FACING SHORES. IF YOU
BECOME CAUGHT IN A RIP CURRENT...REMAIN CALM. STAY AFLOAT WHILE
WAITING FOR HELP. IF YOU HAVE TO SWIM OUT OF A RIP CURRENT...SWIM
PARALLEL TO SHORE...THEN BACK TOWARD THE BEACH WHEN POSSIBLE. DO NOT
ATTEMPT TO SWIM DIRECTLY AGAINST A RIP CURRENT AS YOU WILL TIRE
QUICKLY.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS... ...RIP CURRENTS RISK HAS FALLEN TO MODERATE ALONG EAST REEFS
